required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Figitumumab Combined With Pegvisomant For Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Safety And Tolerability Study Of Figitumumab Combined With Pegvisomant In Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1 study investigating the safety and tolerability of Figitumumab plus Pegvisomant for treatment of advanced solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was closed to enrollment on 18 April 2011 due to inability to recruit patients on a timely basis as well as business reasons. Study closure was not related to any safety concerns.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Screening to the follow-up visit (90 days after last dose of figitimumab)
primary_outcome.description: Counts of participants who had treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), defined as newly occurring or worsening after first dose. AEs were graded using National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), version 3.0 (Grade [Gr] 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Gr 5=Death). Relatedness to [study drug] was assessed by the investigator (Yes/No). Participants with multiple occurrences of an AE within a category were counted once within the category.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 2, Day 1 to Cycle 3, Day 8; from Cycle 1, Day 15 to end of Cycle 2
primary_outcome.description: DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during DLT period and considered related to study medication: Grade (Gr) 4 neutropenia lasting >=7 days, febrile neutropenia (Gr 3 or 4 neutropenia, fever >=38.5 degrees Celsius, lasting over 24 hours), neutropenic infection (Gr >=3 neutropenia, infection); Gr 3 or 4 thrombocytopenia associated with bleeding or Gr 4 thrombocytopenia >=7 days; Gr 3 or 4 lymphopeniab accompanied by an opportunistic infection; other non-hematologic Grade 4 toxicities or symptomatic Gr 3 toxicities that require medical intervention and 14 days to resolve.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Circulating Insulin-like Growth Factor (IGF-1) Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1 (Baseline); Day 1 of subsequent cycles starting from Cycle 2 to Cycle 27; end of treatment (21 days after last dose of figitumumab); follow-up visit (90 days after last dose of figitumumab)
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of the combined therapy with figitumumab and pegvisomant on circulating concentrations of total IGF-1 was assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cycle 1: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Day 1 (within 2 hours before figitumumab infusion), Day 2 (1 hour post figitumumab infusion), Day 8 and Day 15

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 2: Day 1 (within 2 hours before and 1 hour after figitumumab infusion); Cycle 3 to Cycle 17: Day 1 (within 2 hours before figitumumab infusion); end of treatment; 90-day follow-up visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Cycle 1: Plasma Concentration at the Last Quantifiable Time Point (Clast) of Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Day 1 (within 2 hours before figitumumab infusion), Day 2 (1 hour post figitumumab infusion), Day 8 and Day 15

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration at the Last Quantifiable Time Point (Clast) of Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 2: Day 1 (within 2 hours before and 1 hour after figitumumab infusion); Cycle 3 to Cycle 17: Day 1 (within 2 hours before figitumumab infusion); end of treatment; 90-day follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma Concentration at the Last Quantifiable Time Point (Clast) of Figitumumab from Cycle 2 to the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cycle 1: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 2, 8 and 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 of subsequent cycle starting from Cycle 2 (up to Cycle 17); end of treatment ( 21 days after last dose of figitumumab); follow-up visit (90 days after last dose of figitumumab)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast) of figitumumab in cycle 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast)of Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 2: Day 1 (within 2 hours before and 1 hour after figitumumab infusion); Cycle 3 to Cycle 17: Day 1 (within 2 hours before figitumumab infusion); end of treatment; 90-day follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)of figitumumab after Cycle 1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Day 15 (within 2 hours before loading dose), Day 16 (within 2 hours pre-SC dose); Cycle 2: Days 1, 8 and 15 (within 2 hours pre-SC dose); Cycle 3 up to Cycle 17: Day 1 (within 2 hours pre-SC dose); end of treatment; 90-day follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: The trough concentration-time profile (AUCtrough) of pegvisomant was to be analyzed by noncompartmental methods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Glucose Levels Between Fasting and Post Glucose Load
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening; Day 8 of Cycle 1; Day 15 of Cycle 2
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of combining figitumumab with pegvisomant was analyzed to assess whether pegvisomant reverses figitumumab-induced glucose intolerance at various pegvisomant dose levels. The change in glucose load was assessed by Glucose Tolerance Testing (GTT) at baseline (fasting), during Cycle 1 following administration of figitumumab alone (post load), and near the end of Cycle 2 (post load) following combined therapy with figitumumab and pegvisomant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Positive Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) Response for Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 4; end of treatment (21 days after last dose of figitumumab); follow-up visit (90 days after last dose of figitumumab)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with positive total or neutralizing ADA for figitumumab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Screening, odd numbered cycles (predose, Cycle 3, 5, 7 etc.) up to Cycle 27 or end of treatment visit (21 days after last dose of figitumumab)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)version 1.1. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST version 1.1. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

intervention.description: IGF-1R antibody, 20 mg/kg, IV every 3 weeks for up to 1 year
growth hormone antagonist, 10, 20 or 30 mg per day via subcutaneous injection for up to 1 year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients ≥18 years of age with advanced solid tumors for which the combination of figitumumab and pegvisomant are reasonable treatment options.
- Patients between the ages of 10 and 18 years with advanced sarcomas for which there is no available curative therapy or therapy proven to prolong survival with an acceptable quality of life will be included in the Sarcoma Expansion Cohort.
- Adequate recovery from prior therapies.
- Adequate organ function (i.e. bone marrow, kidney, liver)
- Total IGF-1 ≥100 ng/ml (13 nmol/L).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent treatment with any anti-tumor agents.
- Pregnant or breastfeeding females.
- Significant past history or active cardiac disease
- Active infection
- History of diabetes mellitus.
- Glycosylated hemoglobin >5.7

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: advanced solid tumors cancer refractory cancer figitumumab pegvisomant

group.title: Figitumumab 20mg/kg + Pegvisomant 10 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 10 mg subcutaneously once daily, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Figitumumab 20mg/kg + Pegvisomant 20 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 20 mg subcutaneously once daily, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

participants_list.participants: 18 subjects were enrolled; 17 subjects were treated; 1 subject was not eligible.
These subjects withdrew from last study treatment due to progressive disease.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Counts of participants who had treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), defined as newly occurring or worsening after first dose. AEs were graded using National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), version 3.0 (Grade [Gr] 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Gr 5=Death). Relatedness to [study drug] was assessed by the investigator (Yes/No). Participants with multiple occurrences of an AE within a category were counted once within the category.

outcome.population: Safety analysis set: all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of either of the study medications.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
outcome.description: DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during DLT period and considered related to study medication: Grade (Gr) 4 neutropenia lasting >=7 days, febrile neutropenia (Gr 3 or 4 neutropenia, fever >=38.5 degrees Celsius, lasting over 24 hours), neutropenic infection (Gr >=3 neutropenia, infection); Gr 3 or 4 thrombocytopenia associated with bleeding or Gr 4 thrombocytopenia >=7 days; Gr 3 or 4 lymphopeniab accompanied by an opportunistic infection; other non-hematologic Grade 4 toxicities or symptomatic Gr 3 toxicities that require medical intervention and 14 days to resolve.

outcome.population: Safety analysis set: all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of either of the study medications. N=number of participants remained on treatment throughout the required DLT period and included as analyzed for DLT based on the defined DLT evaluability specifications.

outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Day 1 (within 2 hours before figitumumab infusion), Day 2 (1 hour post figitumumab infusion), Day 8 and Day 15
outcome.population: PK samples were not analyzed as the study was terminated prematurely due to lack of operational feasibility and the halt of figitumumab development.

group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 20 mg subcutaneously once daily, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast)of Figitumumab
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)of figitumumab after Cycle 1
measure.population: PK samples were not analyzed as the study was terminated prematurely due to lack of operational feasibility and the halt of figitumumab development.

outcome.title: Area Under the Trough Concentrations (AUCtrough)
outcome.description: The trough concentration-time profile (AUCtrough) of pegvisomant was to be analyzed by noncompartmental methods.
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Day 15 (within 2 hours before loading dose), Day 16 (within 2 hours pre-SC dose); Cycle 2: Days 1, 8 and 15 (within 2 hours pre-SC dose); Cycle 3 up to Cycle 17: Day 1 (within 2 hours pre-SC dose); end of treatment; 90-day follow-up visit
outcome.population: PK samples were not analyzed as the study was terminated prematurely due to lack of operational feasibility and the halt of figitumumab development.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg + Pegvisomant 10 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 10 mg subcutaneously once daily up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Figitumumab 20mg/kg + Pegvisomant 20 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 20 mg subcutaneously once daily, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

measure.title: Area Under the Trough Concentrations (AUCtrough)
measure.description: The trough concentration-time profile (AUCtrough) of pegvisomant was to be analyzed by noncompartmental methods.
measure.population: PK samples were not analyzed as the study was terminated prematurely due to lack of operational feasibility and the halt of figitumumab development.

outcome.title: Mean Change in Glucose Levels Between Fasting and Post Glucose Load
outcome.description: The effect of combining figitumumab with pegvisomant was analyzed to assess whether pegvisomant reverses figitumumab-induced glucose intolerance at various pegvisomant dose levels. The change in glucose load was assessed by Glucose Tolerance Testing (GTT) at baseline (fasting), during Cycle 1 following administration of figitumumab alone (post load), and near the end of Cycle 2 (post load) following combined therapy with figitumumab and pegvisomant.
outcome.time_frame: Screening; Day 8 of Cycle 1; Day 15 of Cycle 2
outcome.population: Glucose tolerance set: All enrolled participants who started treatment and who had at least one baseline or on-study sample submitted. N=number of participants with analyable data for this outcome measure.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg + Pegvisomant 10 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 10 mg subcutaneously once daily up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 20 mg subcutaneously once daily, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). measure.title: Mean Change in Glucose Levels Between Fasting and Post Glucose Load
measure.description: The effect of combining figitumumab with pegvisomant was analyzed to assess whether pegvisomant reverses figitumumab-induced glucose intolerance at various pegvisomant dose levels. The change in glucose load was assessed by Glucose Tolerance Testing (GTT) at baseline (fasting), during Cycle 1 following administration of figitumumab alone (post load), and near the end of Cycle 2 (post load) following combined therapy with figitumumab and pegvisomant.
measure.population: Glucose tolerance set: All enrolled participants who started treatment and who had at least one baseline or on-study sample submitted. N=number of participants with analyable data for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Positive Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) Response for Figitumumab
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with positive total or neutralizing ADA for figitumumab.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 and 4; end of treatment (21 days after last dose of figitumumab); follow-up visit (90 days after last dose of figitumumab)
outcome.population: ADA samples were not analyzed as the study was terminated prematurely due to lack of operational feasibility and the halt of figitumumab development.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg + Pegvisomant 10 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 10 mg subcutaneously once daily up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Figitumumab 20mg/kg + Pegvisomant 20 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 20 mg subcutaneously once daily, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Positive Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) Response for Figitumumab
measure.description: Percentage of participants with positive total or neutralizing ADA for figitumumab.
measure.population: ADA samples were not analyzed as the study was terminated prematurely due to lack of operational feasibility and the halt of figitumumab development.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)version 1.1. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST version 1.1. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.time_frame: From Screening, odd numbered cycles (predose, Cycle 3, 5, 7 etc.) up to Cycle 27 or end of treatment visit (21 days after last dose of figitumumab)
outcome.population: Response-evaluable set: All participants who started Cycle 1 with an adequate baseline tumor assessment and at least 1 follow up tumor assessment.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg + Pegvisomant 10 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 10 mg subcutaneously once daily up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Figitumumab 20mg/kg + Pegvisomant 20 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 20 mg subcutaneously once daily, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)version 1.1. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST version 1.1. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
measure.population: Response-evaluable set: All participants who started Cycle 1 with an adequate baseline tumor assessment and at least 1 follow up tumor assessment.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg + Pegvisomant 10 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 10 mg subcutaneously once daily up to a maximum of 17 cycles (corresponding to 1 year). Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg + Pegvisomant 20 mg
group.description: Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously over 1 to 2.5 hours on Day 1 and 2 of Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent cycles (up to total duration of 27 cycles). Pegvisomant 40 mg subcutaneously on Day 15 of Cycle 1 or Day 1 of Cycle 2 and thereafter pegvisomant 20 mg subcutaneously once daily up to total duration of 27 cycles. Each cycle was of 21 days.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was terminated prematurely due to lack of operational feasibility and the halt of figitumumab development.
